Moderate</baseline> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The organization employs integrity verification tools to detect unauthorized changes to software, firmware, and information.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="System and Information Integrity">aa873dfcdb211010280df36f299619f4</control_family> <control_name>Software, Firmware, and Information Integrity</control_name> <control_number>SI-07</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>SI-07</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards/> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>false</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0011212</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:31</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>3</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; FISCAM: AS-3, CM-4; HIPAA: 45 C.F.R. §164.312(c)(1), 45 C.F.R. §164.312(c)(2), 45 C.F.R. §164.312(e)(2)(i), 45 C.F.R. §164.312(c), 45 C.F.R.; NIST SP: 800-147, 800-155; Code: 5 U.S.C. §552a(e)(5); OMB Memo: M-04-04; OMB Circular A-130: 7.g., and Appendix II;</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>SA-12, SC-8, SC-13, SI-3</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Unauthorized changes to software, firmware, and information can occur due to errors or malicious activity (e.g., tampering). Software includes, for example, operating systems (with key internal components such as kernels, drivers), middleware, and applications. Firmware includes, for example, the Basic Input Output System (BIOS). Information includes metadata such as security attributes associated with information. State-of-the-practice integrity-checking mechanisms (e.g., parity checks, cyclical redundancy checks, cryptographic hashes) and associated tools can automatically monitor the integrity of information systems and hosted applications.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  Detection of unauthorized changes to sensitive information such as personally identifiable information (PII) and systems containing sensitive information is fundamental to ensuring integrity as required by the Privacy Act</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:31</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>3e877dfcdb211010280df36f29961954</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:31</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
